pull_request.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

update.description:
This is the first of a few PRs towards a widget that allows for toggling/configuring of various “displays”.

‌

There is more context about what PRs are to follow in [this meta-ticket](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31) \(to give an idea of what is in/out of scope for this PR\).

‌

There's an example of the widget in `display_plugins.config`added in this PR. There are two example display plugins in this PR:

* `GridDisplay`:

    * uses the code from the `Grid3d` plugin, but that plugin is more for introspecting/adding multiple grids, while the `GridDisplay` just manages a single grid.
    * has configurable properties specific to grids, in addition to the default visibility checkbox for display plugins.
    
* `RealtimeFactorDisplay`:

    * uses some code from the `TimePanel` plugin, but it paints the RTF on the scene instead of displaying it in the widget \(a feature request from the client\).
    * is not very practical at the moment because it always displays the RTF at the origin of the world as opposed to as an Overlay, but it is an example of a display that does not have any custom configurable properties.
    * ~~has loading issues in some situations ~~\(e.g. the `display_plugins.config`example\). In other cases it loads fine. Resolved in [bdf7b019](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/bdf7b01995aee9a4e2cd428c786010e1d1c288aa?at=default)
    

‌

I have tried to match the existing layout/practices of the source code: I added the `DisplayPlugin` baseclass where the `Plugin` class was but can move it into the `displays` directory if appropriate.

‌
update.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

content.raw: I’ve noticed that the current state of this PR does not handle correctly when the requested scene/engine is not available \(plugins assume that they have been initialized, but they haven’t, etc\). Looking into it; wanted to mention to avoid duplicated comments from reviewers.
content.html: I’ve noticed that the current state of this PR does not handle correctly when the requested scene/engine is not available (plugins assume that they have been initialized, but they haven’t, etc). Looking into it; wanted to mention to avoid duplicated comments from reviewers.

pullrequest.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

content.raw:
I’m on-board with not pushing partially functional code to default.  
I’ll leave the incomplete features in this PR for the review process \(I think it’s useful to see two types of displays\), and give another go at setting the visibility. If at the end it’s not resolved, I would be alright will dropping the RTF displaay plugin since it doesn’t use an overlay where it should and it might be a while before that task reaches the top of the stack.

If other blockers-for-merge come up, we can target this PR and followups at a feature branch, so the PRs can be reviewed in small pieces still, and then once the right level of functionality is in the feature branch we can merge that to default.
content.html:
I’m on-board with not pushing partially functional code to default.
I’ll leave the incomplete features in this PR for the review process (I think it’s useful to see two types of displays), and give another go at setting the visibility. If at the end it’s not resolved, I would be alright will dropping the RTF displaay plugin since it doesn’t use an overlay where it should and it might be a while before that task reaches the top of the stack.

If other blockers-for-merge come up, we can target this PR and followups at a feature branch, so the PRs can be reviewed in small pieces still, and then once the right level of functionality is in the feature branch we can merge that to default.

pullrequest.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

content.raw:
Ignition GUI is not being "released" anytime soon; it is my understanding that some downstream users are building a specific revision from source while trying to keep up with what's in the default branch, and our development team is building `default` / `gz11` from source.

In practice, this means we're not committed to a stable API/ABI, but we've been trying not to push untested or partially functional code to default. 

If there is functionality you plan on getting to on future PRs, I'd recommend breaking this PR into smaller chunks so we don't leave anything "broken" on default. For example, you could make a first PR just with the grid display plugin and add the RTF in a future PR. Or maybe completely remove the visibility toggling functionality and add it later... Sounds reasonable?
content.html:
Ignition GUI is not being "released" anytime soon; it is my understanding that some downstream users are building a specific revision from source while trying to keep up with what's in the default branch, and our development team is building default / gz11 from source.

In practice, this means we're not committed to a stable API/ABI, but we've been trying not to push untested or partially functional code to default.

If there is functionality you plan on getting to on future PRs, I'd recommend breaking this PR into smaller chunks so we don't leave anything "broken" on default. For example, you could make a first PR just with the grid display plugin and add the RTF in a future PR. Or maybe completely remove the visibility toggling functionality and add it later... Sounds reasonable?

content.raw: thanks: I've tried a few things without luck, but ultimately this block is planned for removal once we add something like `Visual::SetVisible` in ingition rendering, so I was planning to not let it block this PR. That would mean that there’s some ugly behaviour on the default branch for a while, so I could target these PRs at a feature branch if that’s the preferred development process. \(I think as long as it’s addressed before the next ign-gui release it should be alright to target at default, yeah?\)
content.html: thanks: I've tried a few things without luck, but ultimately this block is planned for removal once we add something like Visual::SetVisible in ingition rendering, so I was planning to not let it block this PR. That would mean that there’s some ugly behaviour on the default branch for a while, so I could target these PRs at a feature branch if that’s the preferred development process. (I think as long as it’s addressed before the next ign-gui release it should be alright to target at default, yeah?)

pull_request.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

pullrequest.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

content.raw:
The flow is that the `DisplayPlugin`'s `LoadConfig` parses general display properties \(e.g. scene and engine\), and sets up the Visual for the subclass to use \(to attach whatever visuals it needs\). At the end of the parent `LoadConfig`, it \[calls the subclass' `Initialize](`[#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137/first-version-of-displays-widget-with/diff#Lsrc/DisplayPlugin.ccT125](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137/first-version-of-displays-widget-with/diff#Lsrc/DisplayPlugin.ccT125)\), to allow the subclass to setup its Visual. This initialization can't be done in the constructor of e.g. `GridDisplayPlugin` because at that time the scene/visual hasn’t been setup yet.

‌

We can separate the subclasses' `Initialize` and `LoadDisplayConfig`and call them separately.
content.html:
The flow is that the DisplayPlugin's LoadConfig parses general display properties (e.g. scene and engine), and sets up the Visual for the subclass to use (to attach whatever visuals it needs). At the end of the parent LoadConfig, it [calls the subclass' Initialize](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137/first-version-of-displays-widget-with/diff#Lsrc/DisplayPlugin.ccT125), to allow the subclass to setup its Visual. This initialization can't be done in the constructor of e.g. GridDisplayPlugin because at that time the scene/visual hasn’t been setup yet.

‌

We can separate the subclasses' Initialize and LoadDisplayConfigand call them separately.

content.raw: Humm I see. I try to only put on `LoadConfig` things which depend on the plugin configuration. Since `Initialize` takes the config pointer, I thought it served the same purpose. Do you foresee some initialization steps which don't depend on the config and cannot go on the constructor?
content.html: Humm I see. I try to only put on LoadConfig things which depend on the plugin configuration. Since Initialize takes the config pointer, I thought it served the same purpose. Do you foresee some initialization steps which don't depend on the config and cannot go on the constructor?

content.raw: Final sounds like a good idea; not sure about `LoadDisplayConfig` because some plugins don’t do much with the config \(e.g. [the RTF one](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/137/first-version-of-displays-widget-with/diff#Lsrc/plugins/displays/RealtimeFactorDisplay.ccT86)\): `Initialize` is more to give them the chance to setup whatever visuals they need. If initialisation is also implied with the Load\* functions in the ignition framework, then that name could make sense!
content.html: Final sounds like a good idea; not sure about LoadDisplayConfig because some plugins don’t do much with the config (e.g. the RTF one): Initialize is more to give them the chance to setup whatever visuals they need. If initialisation is also implied with the Load* functions in the ignition framework, then that name could make sense!

content.raw: I noticed that the derived classes are not overriding this function, and instead are overriding `Initialize`, which seems to serve the same purpose. You could mark this as final here to make sure no subclasses can implement `LoadConfig`.
content.html: I noticed that the derived classes are not overriding this function, and instead are overriding Initialize, which seems to serve the same purpose. You could mark this as final here to make sure no subclasses can implement LoadConfig.

pull_request.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

update.description:
This is the first of a few PRs towards a widget that allows for toggling/configuring of various “displays”.

‌

There is more context about what PRs are to follow in \[this meta-ticket\]\([#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/issues/31)\) \(to give an idea of what is in/out of scope for this PR\).

‌

There's an example of the widget in `display_plugins.config`added in this PR. There are two example display plugins in this PR:

*  `GridDisplay`: 

    * uses the code from the `Grid3d` plugin, but that plugin is more for introspecting/adding multiple grids, while the `GridDisplay` just manages a single grid. 
    * has configurable properties specific to grids, in addition to the default visibility checkbox for display plugins.
    
* `RealtimeFactorDisplay`: 

    * uses some code from the `TimePanel` plugin, but it paints the RTF on the scene instead of displaying it in the widget \(a feature request from the client\).
    * is not very practical at the moment because it always displays the RTF at the origin of the world as opposed to as an Overlay, but it is an example of a display that does not have any custom configurable properties. 
    * has loading issues in some situations \(e.g. the `display_plugins.config`example\). In other cases it loads fine.
    

‌

I have tried to match the existing layout/practices of the source code: I added the `DisplayPlugin` baseclass where the `Plugin` class was but can move it into the `displays` directory if appropriate.

‌
update.title: First version of Displays widget with sample DisplayPlugins

content.raw: I haven't used Ignition Rendering's `MovableText` yet, but if it works the same way as Gazebo's, [setting alpha makes it transparent](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2839/updates-to-movabletext/diff)
content.html: I haven't used Ignition Rendering's MovableText yet, but if it works the same way as Gazebo's, setting alpha makes it transparent
